adjective.description: Zoology. Situated behind the genitals or genital pores; specifically designating the segments of an arthropod posterior to those containing the genital organs.
Botany. Designating fusion of previously distinct plant organs during ontogeny (contrasted with congenital).

origin: Mid 19th century; earliest use found in Alpheus Packard (1839–1905). From post- + genital.
